alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald; Newton; Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 6:43AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald, Newton, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Flat Creek at Highway C and Flat Creek at Highway U. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Cassville, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Pineville, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Anderson, Merriam Woods, Goodman, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Rockaway Beach, Exeter, Wheaton, Indian Point, Branson West, Washburn, Lanagan, Shell Knob, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Butterfield, Mccord Bend, Golden, Table Rock, Emerald Beach, Kirbyville, Eagle Rock, Stella, Chain-O-Lakes, Arrow Point, Coney Island, Jenkins, Cape Fair, Wayne, Lampe, Ridgley, Rocky Comfort and Powell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
